intro: Symplocos verdifolia, commonly known as the greenleaf wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
